headline: How Investors May Respond To Xcel Energy (XEL) Wildfire Lawsuit, Bond Buyback and Board Expansion
summary: Xcel Energy recently faced a lawsuit from the Texas Attorney General alleging negligence in the 2024 Smokehouse Creek wildfire, while also launching cash tender offers to repurchase up to US$345,000,000 of subsidiary bonds and maintaining a quarterly dividend of US$0.57 per share payable in January 2026. At the same time, the company expanded its board to 12 directors by appointing Lockheed Martin executive Maria Demaree, underscoring a focus on digital transformation, risk oversight, and...

At the same time, the company expanded its board to 12 directors by appointing Lockheed Martin executive Maria Demaree, underscoring a focus on digital transformation, risk oversight, and...

headline: Texas Attorney General Sues Xcel Energy Inc. (XEL) unit over Smokehouse Creek Wildfire
summary: Xcel Energy Inc. (NASDAQ:XEL) is among 10 Best Performing Electrical Infrastructure Stocks in 2025. On December 16, 2025, Reuters reported that Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton filed a lawsuit against Southwestern Public Service Company, a division of Xcel Energy Inc. (NASDAQ:XEL), claiming it was responsible for the 2024 Smokehouse Creek wildfire. The fire was the […]
